title: How was the 1920s was important to the changing role of women? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: The 1920's was monumental in changing the role of women...Women were more free during the "Roaring 20's". Many women got college education at this time period, unlike before. This cause there to be more job opportunities for women, in different fields. Also women were more free in going out of their house, they could go to mass social events, ex: baseball games, more often. This caused there to be more freedom for women, and they no longer played the role of " housewife", or with the children all day long. They could earn money for the family, and marriage was now considered more of a partnership.

During the 20's women began to take an active role in work force and politics. They joined labor unions and help organized workers. The suffrage movement put them on equal footing with men political. The Temperance movement brought women's issues to the forefront of politics.
